definitions.definition: The process of bringing an object back to its original state ; the process of restoring something.
examples: The restoration of this painting will take years.
The restoration of this medieval church involved undoing all the Victorian modifications.

definitions.definition: The result of such a process, such as a dental restoration (a dental prosthesis).
examples: These restorations were especially impressive and were reported in a leading prosthodontics journal.

definitions.definition: The return of a former monarchy or monarch to power , usually after having been forced to step down.
examples: The restoration of the House of Stuart took place a few years after the death of Cromwell.
The restoration of the Kingdom of Spain took place immediately after the death of Franco.

definitions.definition: The return of a socioeconomic formation in the role of the dominant mode of production .
examples: The restoration of capitalism in Russia gave rise to unemployment.
The restoration of capitalism in Eastern Europe made way for improvement in human rights.

definitions.definition: The receiving of a sinner to divine favor .

main_definition: The process of bringing an object back to its original state ; the process of restoring something.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) The result of such a process, such as a dental restoration (a dental prosthesis).
The return of a former monarchy or monarch to power , usually after having been forced to step down.
The return of a socioeconomic formation in the role of the dominant mode of production .
( theology ) The receiving of a sinner to divine favor .
